description: Model complex relationships naturally with Neo4j.

slides.title: It's All About Connections ðŸ•¸ï¸
slides.content:
# Relational? No.

Ironically, relational databases (SQL) struggle with complex relationships (many JOINS).

**Graph Databases** treat relationships as first-class citizens.

Great for Social Networks, Fraud Detection, and Recommendation Engines.

slides.title: The Data Model
slides.content:
# Nodes & Edges ðŸ”µ âž¡ï¸ ðŸ”´

- **Nodes:** The entities (e.g., Alice, Movie).
- **Relationships (Edges):** The lines connecting them (e.g., LIKES, ACTED_IN).
- **Properties:** Key-value pairs stored on both nodes and relationships.

slides.title: Cypher Query Language
slides.content:
# SQL for Graphs ðŸ“œ

Neo4j uses **Cypher**.

It uses ASCII art to represent patterns.

`MATCH (p:Person)-[:LIKES]->(m:Movie)`

slides.title: Creating Data
slides.content:

slides.title: Matching Patterns
slides.content:
# FIND ðŸ”Ž

Who loves The Matrix?

FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Syntax Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: In Cypher, how are nodes represented graphically in the query?

slides.title: Variable Length Paths
slides.content:
# Friends of Friends ðŸ¤

Find connections up to 3 hops away.

`MATCH (me:Person)-[:FRIEND*1..3]-(other)`

This is incredibly expensive and difficult in SQL.

slides.title: Shortest Path
slides.content:
# Navigation ðŸ—ºï¸

Find the shortest connections between two nodes.

`MATCH p=shortestPath((alice)-[*]-(bob))`

slides.title: Properties on Relationships
slides.content:
# Rich Context ðŸ·ï¸

Relationships can store data too.

`[:RATED {score: 5}]`

Alice RATED The Matrix with a score of 5.

slides.title: Labels
slides.content:
# Tagging ðŸ·ï¸

A node can have multiple labels.

`CREATE (n:Person:Actor:Director)`

Helps group nodes for faster index lookups.

slides.title: DELETE
slides.content:
# Detach Delete ðŸ’£

You cannot delete a node if it has relationships attached.

`MATCH (n) DETACH DELETE n` (Deletes node and all its relationships).

slides.title: Constraint Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Why might a DELETE operation fail on a node in a graph database?
quizOptions: The node has existing relationships connected to it
The node is currently being read

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Graph ðŸ•¸ï¸

Connect everything.

- **Nodes:** Entities `(a)`.
- **Edges:** Relationships `-[r]->`.
- **Cypher:** ASCII-art query syntax.
- **Use Case:** Recommendation engines.
